results.prompt_sent: I'm starting work on a dark mode feature for our app. Set up everything I need to track this work: create a project for it, then create a workunit inside that project for the implementation work. The workunit should have a clear problem statement and success criteria that you derive from the feature context.

tool_calls.name: create_project

arguments.description: Implementation of dark mode UI theming for the app, including theming of UI components, system preference respect, and settings toggle.
arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature

tool_calls.mcp_result: {"project":{"created_at":"2026-02-25T20:27:39Z","description":"Implementation of dark mode UI theming for the app, including theming of UI components, system preference respect, and settings toggle.","id":"bbe11c4aad6f4808a8d1a4561451e30d","name":"Dark Mode Feature","organization_id":"7ecc4c86996c489fa21c4f9231b5039f","owner_id":"3e3eeb7faeb5408a8ed4146eb15e5892","status":"planning","tags":["dark-mode","ui","theme"],"updated_at":"2026-02-25T20:27:39Z"}}

tool_calls.name: create_workunit

arguments.problem_statement: The app currently lacks a dark mode feature. Users want a system-wide dark theme that respects OS preferences and includes a manual toggle in settings. Implementation must update UI components to support dark theming, ensure proper contrast and accessibility, and provide a persistent user setting.
arguments.success_criteria: All UI components render correctly in dark mode, the system preference toggle works, the manual toggle in settings persists, no visual regressions, meets performance and accessibility standards, documented in release notes.
arguments.description: Implement dark mode theming for the app, including theming of UI components, system preference respect, and settings toggle. This workunit tracks the implementation tasks, subtasks, and related assets.
arguments.name: Dark Mode Implementation

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks
results.prompt_sent: I need to implement user notifications for workunit updates. Think about what steps are actually needed to build this end-to-end, then create a workunit called "Implement User Notifications" and add all the implementation tasks to it. Be thorough — this is a real feature, not a toy example.

results.prompt_sent: We just decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This is important context for the team. Find the notifications workunit and save this as a critical architectural decision, explaining the tradeoffs we considered.

tool_calls.name: search
tool_calls.mcp_result: {"has_next_page":true,"has_prev_page":false,"page_number":1,"results":[{"created_at":"2026-02-25T20:26:45Z","id":"c664f7b44e5448918b9f39e746447bf0","name":"Implement User Notifications","problem_statement":"Users need to be notified when workunits they follow are updated, but no notification system exists yet.","relevance_score":559,"type":"workunit","updated_at":"2026-02-25T20:26:45Z","workunit_id":"00000000000000000000000000000000"}],"total_count":1,"total_pages":5}

tool_calls.name: save_context

arguments.title: Architectural Decision: Use WebSockets for Real-Time Notifications
arguments.content: We evaluated polling and WebSocket approaches for real-time notifications. WebSockets were chosen because they reduce latency, eliminate repeated HTTP requests, lower server load, and provide persistent bidirectional communication, which is essential for timely alerts. Although WebSockets introduce added complexity in connection management and require careful handling of network failures, the performance benefits and better scalability for high-frequency notifications outweigh these concerns. This decision impacts the notifications service architecture and may affect related components like the push notification gateway and client library.

results.task_name: Create a project with linked asset
results.prompt_sent: Set up a new project called "API v2" for our REST API redesign work. This project will be tracked in our GitHub repo at github.com/example/api-v2 on the main branch. Also create a knowledge asset called "API v2 Design Spec" and link it to the project — it's a document describing the new API design.
